text: Howdy from the UK, I am a developer for an eLearning company and have been given the task of building the new company website in HubSpot so looking forward to rolling my sleeves up and getting stuck in :slightly_smiling_face:
Hello, we are a company from switzerland and like to build a memberarea in HubSpot CMS like a control Panel or a Login area. And ideas if it Could work??

just did this recently. It’s a bit complicated and can only be made so secure. I’d actually recommend waiting to build functionality like this as HS is currently working on a membership functionality themselves for users on the front end. Their system will be more secure than what you can currently create, and will be much easier to manage.
Hello! we're a inbound marketing agency from Barcelona. Happy to help us if something needed :slightly_smiling_face:

Welcome <@UDCTHBDSB> and congrats on jumping head first into HubSpot CMS :slightly_smiling_face: This will be a great place to help answer your questions.

What CMS have you developed on in the past?

Have any initial questions about coding on HubSpot CMS?
Did you manage the Website with HubSpot? And The memberarea with themselves?

Yup, as Jon mentioned above - We just released "Memberships" in beta. This will allow you to restrict content and require login access. It is based on contacts and list memberships. Currently it's in beta and only available in the Enterprise portals.

Another option to research is <http://booya.inboundlabs.co/>

This is a oAuth social sign-in app built by our friends at InboundLabs.
Hi Luke, Could we use is in BETA?
Sounds good!
Welcome Francesc! :wave: Love Barcelona!!! .... Do you offer HubSpot CMS design and development at your agency?
I would like to test the Beta Version in HubSpot:wink:if it is possible
Let me ask if there's a beta sign up
:slightly_smiling_face:
one minute

What I did was fully managed in HubSpot but the interface for doing so is via a custom module in a page - we authenticated users and their passwords through an ajaxy method and redirected the user to their appropriate page then authenticated that user using a time sensitive token stored as a cookie, if the user didn’t have the cookie the contents of the page are not rendered and the user is immediately redirected.

I recommend going the HS memberships route instead, as it will work smoother and will get better over time also probably be more secure.
Do you already have an Enterprise Marketing Hub portal <@UDATKECAD>?
Well you're in a great spot to knock off the dust and have a great community here to support you!
Good luck on the project!
Being new to HubSpot CMS... have you gained access to the CMS Developer Discovery Kit?
This is a great place to jumpstart onto HubSpot CMS
No, we like to Build the Login area with the CMS:wink:
Sound Great Luke:+1::+1::+1::+1::+1:
Jon, Could you send me the Link to the HS membership? Please...
Luke would have to do that. I’m not a HS employee I can’t get you into a beta.
Aha, sorry!!!!
Thanks Luke, I have a lot of experience with WordPress as well as almost a year of Moodle & Totara Learn experience.
I really like the HubSpot CMS, so far it has been a learning experience but I have got the hang of it now and this community will be an invaluale resource for me :smile:

Brilliant! - excited to have you a part of our community! Glad you're getting the hang of it. Were you able to get into the CMS Developer Discovery Kit? ... this is a great resource for starting on HubSpot CMS
The Memberships is only for Marketing Hub Enterprise right now. Sorry :disappointed: I wish it was included in the CMS. (I would imagine in the future it might).
Might have to look at other options
Hmmmmm..... not good:relieved::relieved::relieved::relieved::relieved::relieved::relieved::relieved:
But maybe you have an other idea?

well, if it meets your clients needs - you could use HS password protected pages instead

Basically it requires the user to enter a password(specific to the page) in order to see the page
It would not work like a traditional username and password login, it just takes a password, and the password is tied to the page, it’s not user based
Also, maybe repost this question (explaining memberships won't work as you're using the stand-alone CMS, not marketing hub) and see what other community members think?
hi there! i'm a front end developer using HubSpot cms for the firm i work for full time!
Good idea!
Thanks Luke and Jon:+1::+1::+1:
What's up <@UDC6ATL20> - Welcome. We're excited to have you a part of our HubSpot CMS developer community. Rock on!
